attributes.action: Listen to the opinion of the public majority
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It seems strange to me that my region of this country had a referendum on the congestion charge to improve public transport (Greater Manchester)

I think this referendum would have been legitimate if the opinion of the public majority mattered anyway. Such a tiny thing does get votes but when it comes to things like...

The war in Iraq and Afghanistan,
the Lisbon treaty, the European Union and even who our actual prime minister is!!  These things are not important enough for the public majority but a simple congestion charge is?

Prime minister LISTEN TO THE PEOPLE!

1, Hold a general election.
2, Pull the troops out.
3, Give a referendum on the Lisbon treaty.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
